授業の概要・背景: Classes will have the instructor introduce the topic, an activity to help students prepare for the topic(s) described in the book, a series of activities, and the class will conclude with students being able to share their own ideas. The focus of this class is vocabulary, speaking, grammar, listening and reading.  In each lesson, students will develop their ability to communicate in English by speaking in pairs or in small groups.  The content of the lesson is based on the textbook, but students will sometimes participate in extra communication activities.  Students should be prepared for frequent discussion activities, in which they will learn and practice appropriate language for a range of communication situations (for example: asking for opinions, expressing opinions, disagreeing, offering advice, persuading others, etc.). Students will be expected to participate in an 'English only' learning environment.
授業方法:
We will be a face-to-face class. 

The instructor will be a facilitator of various tasks to help students connect with each other and speak English. There will be ample opportunity for pair work.

Discussion: Students hold discussions in class. In addition to discussions between pairs of students, group discussions are sometimes held as well.

Presentation: As the main activities, students summarize the results of their own learning activities and present them.

Pair work: Students perform learning activities in pairs.

Group work: Students make groups of three members or more to perform learning activities.

第1回: Introduction, course overview, Mr. Michael Lin’s rules and requests, instructor’s contact information. Set-up the Microsoft Teams and Slack App.
第2回: Unit 1: I’d like to be a pilot (Part 1) What kind of job would you like? What do you want to be someday? Pg. 6 – 11.

HW #1 Due – Buy the textbook. Make sure you can check Luna. Make sure you can access your KGU e-mail account. Make sure you have the Microsoft Teams and Slack app. *Homework may be adjusted depending on how the class goes.
第3回: Unit 1: I’d like to be a pilot (Part 2) What’s extreme? Would you like an extreme job? Pg. 12 – 17. Choose groups.
第4回: Unit 2: Which one is Bruno? (Part 1) Who’s your friend? What’s your best friend like? Pg. 18 – 23.
HW #2 Due – Complete Unit 1 WB Pg. 4 – 9. Submit on MS Teams. Choose groups.
第5回: Unit 2: Which one is Bruno? (Part 2) Who’s an unsung hero? Who is your hero? Pg. 24 – 29. Choose topics.
第6回: Unit 3: We have to reduce trash! (Part 1) What is the plastic problem? What should we do? Pg. 30 – 35. Quiz #1 – Unit 1 and 2 (20%) Submit on MS Teams.
HW #3 Due – Complete Unit 2 WB Pg. 10 – 15. Submit on MS Teams. Choose topics.
第7回: Unit 3: We have to reduce trash! (Part 2) What are 6 things we can do about plastic? How can we improve the environment? Pg. 36 – 41. Choose sources.
第8回: Unit 4: How do sloths move? (Part 1) What are your favorite animals? If you could be any animal, what would you be? Why? Pg. 42 – 47.
HW #4 Due – Complete Unit 3 WB Pg. 16 – 21. Submit on MS Teams. Choose sources.
第9回: Unit 4: How do sloths move? (Part 2) What can we learn from animals? How can society be nicer to each other? Pg. 48 – 53. Choose dates.
第10回: Unit 5: I’m meeting friends later (Part 1) What are you doing this weekend? What are fun things to do in 2023? Pg. 54 – 59. Quiz #2 – Unit 3 and 4 (20%) Submit on MS Teams.
HW #5 Due – Complete Unit 4 WB Pg. 22 – 27. Submit on MS Teams. Choose dates.
第11回: Unit 5: I’m meeting friends later (Part 2) What are some apps you use? How can we help each other connect better? Pg. 60 – 65. Presentation script.
第12回: Final Oral Assessment Preparation - Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 1 to 5 or a subject students are interested in. Students should speak for at least 1 minute. Write about 100 words for 1 minute of speech. Prepare a PowerPoint presentation (3 - 4 slides). Edit and practice your delivery. (2-member group = 2 minutes; 3-member group = 3 minutes). Bring your PCs!

HW #6 Due – Submit the first draft of your script with all the members' content on a Word document and submit the first draft of your PPT slides. Submit on MS Teams. (All HW Submissions 20%) Presentation script.
第13回: Final Oral Assessment - 30%. Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 1 to 5 or a subject students are interested in. Students should speak for at least 1 minute. (2-member group = 2 minutes; 3-member group = 3 minutes).

The evening (10pm) before the final oral assessment please send your final script with both members' content on a Word document and submit your final PPT slides through a resubmission of HW #6 or through the Slack App.
第14回: (Make up and feedback) Final Oral Assessment - 30%. Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 1 to 5 or a subject students are interested in. Students should speak for at least 1 minute. (2-member group = 2 minutes; 3-member group = 3 minutes). Final class feedback.
トピック.授業計画1: Students at times you may need a laptop computer or a portable device with wifi connection. Be sure you can access Luna, KWIC, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Slack, your KGU e-mail address, and have a Google account.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are required to prepare for class and when appropriate review. Students are required to bring their textbook, a pen or pencil, paper, and a dictionary to class. There is homework in the course and all homework will be facilitated through the Microsoft Teams App and Assignments function. Expect to spend about 30 minutes each week previewing and reviewing the textbook contents. Expect to spend an additional 1 hour every other week or 30 minutes each week completing homework assignments.

評価.教科書Required texts0: Time Zones 3A (Third Edition) by David Bohlke and Andrew Boon.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1
※kwicへのリンクとなります（在学生のみ閲覧可）
評価.備考Note0: Students are expected to speak English only in class. You will not pass the course if you miss more than five (5) classes. If you are more than five (5) minutes late for class, you will be considered late. Three (3) lates will equal one (1) absence. An absence or tardy is only excused when documentation is provided by Kyomu (Academic Affairs Office). Mr. Lin's e-mail is fts77833@kwansei.ac.jp. All homework will be facilitated on the Microsoft Teams App through Assignments. Students will submit their homework assignments through MS Teams Assignments. Homework should always be submitted (usually at the beginning of class) on the day that it’s due. If there are exceptions, Mr. Lin will let students know. Mr. Lin will explain how to submit in class. All tasks of the class should be completed by their due dates. Mr. Lin does not allow students to mass submit (a semester's worth of work) at the end of classes or after the end of classes.

name: 【100】英語Iｂ　１８／English Ib
担当者: リン　マイケル　Ｐ．（LIN MICHAEL P.）
成績評価備考:
備考　Note
Class Participation – 10%
Assignments – 20%
Quiz #1 – 20%
Quiz #2 – 20%
Final Oral Assessment - 30%
Total – 100%

Average Grades For The Department - 70 - 75.

The student's grade will be based on quizzes, writing assignments, and oral presentations. No final exam will be given during the exam period. Those students who miss five or more classes during the term will receive 0 points for this course.
